III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/30/24, five staff at the facility beat Youth A in the face and
leg.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
08/09/2024.
Complainant was interviewed on 08/09/2024 via telephone.
Complainant reported Youth A did not report having any injuries.
JJ Worker was interviewed on 08/09/2024 via telephone. JJ
Worker reported Youth A told her he was hit in the face and leg by
5 staff members on 07/30/2024. JJ Worker is not sure Youth A is
being truthful. She said Youth A has been at the facility for one
month and she has several reports of Youth A assaulting staff.
She is not aware of Youth A being restrained or put in seclusion.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 08/13/2024 via
telephone. Foster Care Worker reported she was informed of the
incident on 07/30/2024 involving Youth A assaulting the therapist.
She is not aware of any incidents of staff assaulting or putting
Youth A in seclusion. She expressed no concerns for the facility.
Administrator 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/14/2024.
Administrator 1 reported Youth A was arrested on 08/12/2024 and
transferred to the Wayne County Jail due to assaulting staff.
Administrator 1 said there was an incident involving Youth A on
07/30/2024, but Youth A was the one that assaulted his therapist.
Administrator 1 denied staff hit or restrained Youth A. She said
Youth A took the Therapist radio, threw his shoe at Therapist, and
broke the radio.
2

Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 08/14/2024. Therapist
has been working at the facility for 5 years. She has been working
with Youth A for approximately one month. She was on Pod 3 with
Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A became upset because he wanted to
be able to pick the staff assigned to his pod. Youth A took
Therapist’s radio, she attempted to verbally get Youth A to give
her back the radio. Youth A then threw his shoe at Therapist. Staff
2 and Staff 3 came to the pod and continued to verbally de-
escalate Youth A and that’s when Youth A threw the radio against
the wall and broke it. She denied Youth A was physically
restrained during or hurt during this incident. She said Youth A
calmed down after throwing the radio and no further incident
occurred that evening.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/14/2024. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for three months. Staff 1 recalled an
incident on 07/30/2024 involving Youth A. He reported Youth A
took the Therapist radio, threw his shoe at Therapist and broke
the radio. Staff 1 said Therapist and Staff 2 and Staff 3 used
verbal de-escalation and did not touch or attempt to restrain Youth
A. Staff 1 is not aware of any incident where Youth A was
physical assaulted by staff.
Youth A was interviewed at the Wayne County Jail on
08/16/2024. Youth A reported he was placed at Calumet Center
for approximately one month. Youth A reported there was an
incident, but he was not sure of the date when Administrator 2 and
several staff members attacked him on the pod. He believes it was
on 07/28/2024 but was not sure of the date. Youth A reported
there were no other youths on the pod. Youth A could not recall
the staff members names. Youth A denied being injured or hurt
during the incident. Youth A admitted on 08/12/2024 he
threatened and attempted to assault staff, which resulted in him
getting arrested.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were interviewed at the facility on 08/16/2024.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were called to assist Therapist with Youth A on
07/30/2024. Staff 2 and Staff 3 denied Youth A was assaulted or
restrained.
Administrator 2 was interviewed on 08/20/2024 via telephone.
Administrator 2 has been working at the facility for 6 months.
Administrator 2 denied being aware of any incidents where Youth
A was assaulted. He recalls several incidents where Youth A had
assaulted staff.
3

Video Reviewed:
Video footage was reviewed on 08/14/2024, video date is
07/30/2024 at approximately 6:00 pm. (Note: video has no audio).
Youth A is observed on Pod 3 with Therapist and Staff 1. Youth A
grabbed the therapist radio out of her hand. Therapist appeared to
be talking to Youth A, Youth A walked away from Therapist. Youth
A threw his shoe at Therapist and two other staff enter the pod.
Youth A threw the radio, Therapist and Staff 1 appear to continue
to be talking to Youth A. At no point in the video does any staff or
Therapist physically touch Youth A. Youth A appeared to have
calmed down after he threw the radio.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report for malicious destruction of property and
assault on staff dated 07/30/2024 written by Staff 3.
Therapist was meeting with Youth A, and Youth A got mad
because he could not pick who was going to monitor him.
Youth A took Therapist radio. Therapist attempted to
verbally de-escalate Youth A to give her back the radio.
Youth A threw his shoe at Therapist, striking her in the arm.
Therapist and Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 continued to
attempt to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Youth A threw the
radio at the wall breaking the radio. Note: there are no
incident reports involving Youth A being restrained or
secluded.
• There were no incident reports pertaining to Youth A being
assaulted.
• Medical assessment for Youth A dated 07/31/2024. Youth
A reported being restrained and was examined by doctor
and no injuries noted.
• Therapist and Administrator 2 personnel file: They have no
disciplinary records.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule based on
documentation, and interviews with staff and youths. There is no
supporting evidence these allegations occurred.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion
Title plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (3) Seclusion must be performed in a manner that is safe,
Description appropriate, and consistent with the youth's chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history, including
history of trauma.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was locked in his room for seven days without food or
being allowed to shower. Law enforcement was not notified.
Investigation JJ Worker reported she is not aware of any incidents involving
Youth A being put in a seclusion during his placement at the
facility.
Administrator 1 reported Youth A was at the facility for 30 days
and there are no incident reports indicating Youth A was secluded
in his room.
Therapist denied Youth A was secluded in his room on
07/30/2024 or on any other date.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 denied Youth A was put in seclusion
for seven days.
Youth A reported Administrator 2 put him in seclusion for 10 days,
and he was not allowed to shower or eat. Youth A was not sure
what date this happened but thinks it may have been on
07/28/2024.
Administrator 2 denied Youth A was ever secluded in his room.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage was reviewed on 08/14/2024, video date is
07/30/2024 and was viewed from approximately 6:00pm to
7:00pm. Youth A was not observed to have been put in seclusion
Documents Reviewed:
• There were no seclusion documentation pertaining to
Youth A.
5

Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule based on
interviews with staff and youths. There is no supporting evidence
these allegations occurred.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
